programme.title: College Football
programme.sub-title: ACC Championship: Clemson vs. North Carolina
programme.desc: The 2022 ACC Championship game sees Drake Maye's Tar Heels duel the Tigers in Charlotte, N.C. Maye's 35 touchdown passes helped put North Carolina in the title game for the first time since 2015, when Clemson's win began a run of six straight crowns.

programme.title: College Football
programme.sub-title: ACC Championship: Pittsburgh vs. Wake Forest
programme.desc: The No. 15 Panthers (10-2) and No. 16 Demon Deacons (10-2) collide in the ACC championship game. Pittsburgh seeks its first conference title. Wake Forest wore the crown in 2006. The Deacons' Sam Hartman is ninth nationally with 34 TD passes in 2021.

programme.desc: The streaking Gators (7-5) get it on with the Green Wave (9-4) in the Gasparilla Bowl. Florida has won three in a row after defeating rival Florida State 31-11. Tulane lost at Army 35-14 in the American Athletic Conference championship game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Cavaliers (6-5) welcome the Eagles (6-5) to John Paul Jones Arena. On Dec. 18, Virginia couldn't hold an 11-point second-half lead in a 64-62 loss to No. 21 Memphis, while American had its five-game win streak stopped by Saint Joseph's, 84-57.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Wolfpack host the Broncs. NC State is 7-4 after a 75-60 loss at then-No. 10 Kansas. Wolfpack senior guard Marcus Hill paces a well-balanced scoring attack with 12.7 points per game. Rider is 0-3 versus major conference teams this season.

programme.desc: The Dolphins (5-8) make the trip to the Hoosier State to face the Fighting Irish (6-5). Notre Dame is on a two-game win streak, with sophomore guard Braeden Shrewsberry averaging 23.5 points in those victories. Le Moyne is 3-5 away from home.
